messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 372
messages.msgSnippet: ... April - I m not sure what I would do if it weren t for instant messaging and Runescape (an on-line game where you talk to other people who are also
messages.messageBody:
> >
> > I AM DESPERATELY TRYING TO FIND THINGS FOR MY KIDS TO DO WITH
> > KIDS THEIR OWN AGE. > > ~APRIL (FROM LANSING AREA, MICHIGAN)
>

April - I'm not sure what I would do if it weren't for instant messaging and Runescape (an on-line game where you talk to other people who are also playing.) The kids can talk to their friends anytime their friends are on-line. And we have to travel to see their friends that live close enough, and stay in a hotel to do it. My husband and I have been discussing the need to travel even further abroad now that they have on-line friends so far away. Pretty soon we will need to get in an airplane instead of in a car! It's hard to get together with other families because everyone is busy doing their own thing! I guess that's why instant messaging is working so well for us--the kids get to tak to their friends without being dependent on me to take them somewhere. Deirdre in Alabama
